intro: Carex muricata f. mediterranea, commonly known as the Mediterranean sedge, is a variant of the common sedge species. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its grass-like leaves and cylindrical inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream edges. Its botanical features include narrow, linear leaves and small, greenish flowers that develop into dark褐色 berries. This subspecies is adapted to temperate climates and is valued for its ornamental and ecological benefits.
